column4: how can you tell what application/process is running your sound in PulseAudio?
I can't get sound in anything else because it says that sound is already running on another process
i may be able to answer that as I recenntly did PA stuff.
do you have the PA applet at the mo?
nope, I don't have that installed
ok just a mo, i will retrieve the webpage that will help you.
thanks for trying to help
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?p=4928900 try that. I've already run through it so gimme a yell if theres something you dont understand.
alright thanks, I'll give it a whirll
that page may help you.
I'll run through it
sudo apt-get install pidgin
from a terminal
Applications > Accessories > Terminal
Thanks. But im thinking if they arent in the repos, that wont work.
& Flannel: i guess what im asking is more this... teach me how to work with source files so i can learn how to do it myself. are you able to do that with me?
yeah I saw after I typed that you're looking for the most up-to-date
if you install by source it won't auto update in the future
get your "buddies" to install pidgin! it's cross platform
I'm talking about me...upgrading to the latest version...using a source file.
compiling from source can be opening a can-o-worms sometimes
what they call "dependency hell"..i'm hesitant to recommend that
